findings.title: Reentrancy
findings.description: Violation of checks-effects-interactions principle leading to re-entrancy attack vector.

findings.title: Non-lockable user withdrawals in VotingEscrowV2
findings.description: The withdraw() function in VotingEscrowV2 contract can be paused with the addition of the new whenNotPaused modifier, which may cause non-custodial design issues.

findings.title: Suggested Adherence Of Checks-Effects-Interactions Pattern
findings.description: A common coding best practice in Solidity is the adherence of `checks-effects-interactions` principle. This principle is effective in mitigating a serious attack vector known as `re-entrancy`.

findings.title: Suggested Constant/Immutable Usages For Gas Efficiency
findings.description: Declare state variables as constants or immutable for gas efficiency, particularly stepSize, minRange, and maxOption can be declared as constant while votingEscrow can be defined as immutable.

findings.title: Proper dailyProtocolFeeRate validation in Fund constructor
findings.description: The `constructor` function evaluates the current `dailyProtocolFeeRate` against the `MAX_ DAILY_PROTOCOL_FEE_RATE` before it has been initialized, and the proper validation should be `require(dailyProtocolFeeRate_ <= MAX_DAILY_PROTOCOL_FEE_RATE)`.

findings.title: Generation of meaningful events in fund
findings.description: The Fund contract lacks emitting important events that reflect state changes when tranche tokens are being minted or burned.

findings.title: Improper Authentication
findings.description: The initializeV2 function does not properly restrict access to only the trusted owner.

findings.title: Declaration of variable with unnecessarily wide scope
findings.description: Some variables such as stepSize, minRange, and maxOption can be declared as constant while votingEscrow can be defined as immutable for gas efficiency.

findings.title: Inconsistent naming conventions for identifiers
findings.description: The function initializeV2 has inconsistent naming conventions for its identifiers.

findings.title: Use of a non-reentrant function in a concurrent context
findings.description: The `deposit()` function in `StakingV2` contract violates the `checks-effects-interactions` principle, making it vulnerable to re-entrancy attacks.

findings.title: Improper Enforcement of a Single, Unique Action
findings.description: This CWE describes the scenario where a single action is not properly enforced.
